00022 /*!
00023  * \mainpage res_sqlite
00024  * 
00025  * \section intro_sec Presentation
00026  * 
00027  * res_sqlite is a module for the Asterisk Open Source PBX to support SQLite 2
00028  * databases. It can be used to fetch configuration from a database (static
00029  * configuration files and/or using the Asterisk RealTime Architecture - ARA).
00030  * It can also be used to log CDR entries. Finally, it can be used for simple
00031  * queries in the Dialplan. Note that Asterisk already comes with a module
00032  * named cdr_sqlite. There are two reasons for including it in res_sqlite:
00033  * the first is that rewriting it was a training to learn how to write a
00034  * simple module for Asterisk, the other is to have the same database open for
00035  * all kinds of operations, which improves reliability and performance.
00036  * 
00037  * There is already a module for SQLite 3 (named res_sqlite3) in the Asterisk
00038  * addons. res_sqlite was developed because we, at Proformatique, are using
00039  * PHP 4 in our embedded systems, and PHP 4 has no stable support for SQLite 3
00040  * at this time. We also needed RealTime support.
00041  * 
00042  * \section build_install_sec Building and installing
00043  * 
00044  * To build res_sqlite, simply enter <code>make</code>. To install it,
00045  * enter make install. The Makefile has been slightly designed for
00046  * cross compilation and installation in non standard locations, to ease
00047  * the work of packagers. Read it for more details.
00048  * 
00049  * \section conf_sec Configuration
00050  * 
00051  * The main configuration file is res_config_sqlite.conf. It must be readable or
00052  * res_sqlite will fail to start. It is suggested to use the sample file
00053  * in this package as a starting point. The file has only one section
00054  * named <code>general</code>. Here are the supported parameters :
00055  * 
00056  * <dl>
00057  * <dt><code>dbfile</code></dt>
00058  * <dd>The absolute path to the SQLite database (the file can be non existent,
00059  *       res_sqlite will create it if is has the appropriate rights)</dd>
00060  * <dt><code>config_table</code></dt>
00061  * <dd>The table used for static configuration</dd>
00062  * <dt><code>cdr_table</code></dt>
00063  * <dd>The table used to store CDR entries (if ommitted, CDR support is
00064  *       disabled)</dd>
00065  * </dl>
00066  * 
00067  * To use res_sqlite for static and/or RealTime configuration, refer to the
00068  * Asterisk documentation. The file tables.sql can be used to create the
00069  * needed tables.
00070  * 
00071  * The SQLITE() application is very similar to the MYSQL() application. You
00072  * can find more details at
00073  * <a href="http://voip-info.org/wiki/view/Asterisk+cmd+MYSQL">http://voip-info.org/wiki/view/Asterisk+cmd+MYSQL</a>.
00074  * The main difference is that you cannot choose your database - it's the
00075  * file set in the <code>dbfile</code> parameter. As a result, there is no
00076  * Connect or Disconnect command, and there is no connid variable.
00077  * 
00078  * \section status_sec Driver status
00079  * 
00080  * The CLI command <code>show sqlite status</code> returns status information
00081  * about the running driver. One information is more important than others:
00082  * the number of registered virtual machines. A SQLite virtual machine is
00083  * created each time a SQLITE() query command is used. If the number of
00084  * registered virtual machines isn't 0 (or near 0, since one or more SQLITE()
00085  * commands can be running when requesting the module status) and increases
00086  * over time, this probably means that you're badly using the application
00087  * and you're creating resource leaks. You should check your Dialplan and
00088  * reload res_sqlite (by unloading and then loading again - reloading isn't
00089  * supported)
00090  * 
00091  * \section credits_sec Credits
00092  * 
00093  * res_sqlite was developed by Richard Braun at the Proformatique company.
00094  */
00095 
00096 /*!
00097  * \file res_sqlite.c
00098  * \brief res_sqlite module.
00099  */
00100

00102    <depend>sqlite</depend>
00103  ***/

00123 #define RES_SQLITE_NAME "res_sqlite"
00124 #define RES_SQLITE_DRIVER "sqlite"
00125 #define RES_SQLITE_APP_DRIVER "SQLITE"
00126 #define RES_SQLITE_DESCRIPTION "Resource Module for SQLite 2"
00127 #define RES_SQLITE_CONF_FILE "res_config_sqlite.conf"
00128 #define RES_SQLITE_APP_SYNOPSIS "Dialplan access to SQLite 2"
00129 #define RES_SQLITE_APP_DESCRIPTION \
00130 "SQLITE(): " RES_SQLITE_APP_SYNOPSIS "\n"
00131 #define RES_SQLITE_STATUS_SUMMARY \
00132 "Show status information about the SQLite 2 driver"
00133 #define RES_SQLITE_STATUS_USAGE \
00134 "Usage: show sqlite status\n" \
00135 "  " RES_SQLITE_STATUS_SUMMARY "\n"
00136 
00137 enum {
00138    RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_ID,
00139    RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_COMMENTED,
00140    RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_FILENAME,
00141    RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_CATEGORY,
00142    RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_VAR_NAME,
00143    RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_VAR_VAL,
00144    RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_COLUMNS,
00145 };

00147 /*!
00148  * Limit the number of maximum simultaneous registered SQLite VMs to avoid
00149  * a denial of service attack.
00150  */
00151 #define RES_SQLITE_VM_MAX 1024
00152 
00153 #define SET_VAR(config, to, from) \
00154 do \
00155    { \
00156       int __error; \
00157       __error = set_var(&to, #to, from->value); \
00158       if (__error) \
00159          { \
00160             ast_config_destroy(config); \
00161             unload_config(); \
00162             return 1; \
00163          } \
00164    } \
00165 while (0)
00166 
00167 /*!
00168  * Maximum number of loops before giving up executing a query. Calls to
00169  * sqlite_xxx() functions which can return SQLITE_BUSY or SQLITE_LOCKED
00170  * are enclosed by RES_SQLITE_BEGIN and RES_SQLITE_END, e.g.
00171  * <pre>
00172  * char *errormsg;
00173  * int error;
00174  * 
00175  * RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
00176  *  error = sqlite_exec(db, query, NULL, NULL, &errormsg);
00177  * RES_SQLITE_END(error)
00178  * 
00179  * if (error)
00180  *  ...;
00181  * </pre>
00182  */
00183 #define RES_SQLITE_MAX_LOOPS 10
00184 
00185 /*!
00186  * Macro used before executing a query.
00187  * 
00188  * \see RES_SQLITE_MAX_LOOPS.
00189  */
00190 #define RES_SQLITE_BEGIN \
00191 { \
00192    int __i; \
00193    for (__i = 0; __i < RES_SQLITE_MAX_LOOPS; __i++) \
00194       {
00195 
00196 /*!
00197  * Macro used after executing a query.
00198  * 
00199  * \see RES_SQLITE_MAX_LOOPS.
00200  */
00201 #define RES_SQLITE_END(error) \
00202          if (error != SQLITE_BUSY && error != SQLITE_LOCKED) \
00203             break; \
00204          usleep(1000); \
00205       } \
00206 }
00207

00277 static int cdr_handler(struct ast_cdr *cdr);

00279 /*!
00280  * SQLite callback function for static configuration.
00281  * 
00282  * This function is passed to the SQLite engine as a callback function to
00283  * parse a row and store it in a struct ast_config object. It relies on
00284  * resulting rows being sorted by category.
00285  * 
00286  * \param arg            a pointer to a struct cfg_entry_args object
00287  * \param argc          number of columns
00288  * \param argv          values in the row
00289  * \param columnNames names and types of the columns
00290  * \return 1 if an error occurred, 0 otherwise
00291  * \see cfg_entry_args
00292  * \see sql_get_config_table
00293  * \see config_handler()
00294  */
00295 static int add_cfg_entry(void *arg, int argc, char **argv, char **columnNames);
00296 
00297 /*!
00298  * Asterisk callback function for static configuration.
00299  * 
00300  * Asterisk will call this function when it loads its static configuration,
00301  * which usually happens at startup and reload.
00302  * 
00303  * \param database the database to use (ignored)
00304  * \param table      the table to use
00305  * \param file     the file to load from the database
00306  * \param cfg        the struct ast_config object to use when storing variables
00307  * \return NULL if an error occurred, cfg otherwise
00308  * \see add_cfg_entry()
00309  */
00310 static struct ast_config * config_handler(const char *database,
00311    const char *table, const char *file,
00312    struct ast_config *cfg, int withcomments);
00313 
00314 /*!
00315  * Helper function to parse a va_list object into 2 dynamic arrays of
00316  * strings, parameters and values.
00317  * 
00318  * ap must have the following format : param1 val1 param2 val2 param3 val3 ...
00319  * arguments will be extracted to create 2 arrays:
00320  * 
00321  * <ul>
00322  * <li>params : param1 param2 param3 ...</li>
00323  * <li>vals : val1 val2 val3 ...</li>
00324  * </ul>
00325  * 
00326  * The address of these arrays are stored in params_ptr and vals_ptr. It
00327  * is the responsibility of the caller to release the memory of these arrays.
00328  * It is considered an error that va_list has a null or odd number of strings.
00329  * 
00330  * \param ap             the va_list object to parse
00331  * \param params_ptr where the address of the params array is stored
00332  * \param vals_ptr    where the address of the vals array is stored
00333  * \return 0 if an error occurred, the number of elements in the arrays (which
00334  *           have the same size) otherwise
00335  */
00336 static size_t get_params(va_list ap, const char ***params_ptr,
00337    const char ***vals_ptr);
00338 
00339 /*!
00340  * SQLite callback function for RealTime configuration.
00341  * 
00342  * This function is passed to the SQLite engine as a callback function to
00343  * parse a row and store it in a linked list of struct ast_variable objects.
00344  * 
00345  * \param arg            a pointer to a struct rt_cfg_entry_args object
00346  * \param argc          number of columns
00347  * \param argv          values in the row
00348  * \param columnNames names and types of the columns
00349  * \return 1 if an error occurred, 0 otherwise
00350  * \see rt_cfg_entry_args
00351  * \see realtime_handler()
00352  */
00353 static int add_rt_cfg_entry(void *arg, int argc, char **argv,
00354    char **columnNames);
00355 
00356 /*!
00357  * Asterisk callback function for RealTime configuration.
00358  * 
00359  * Asterisk will call this function each time it requires a variable
00360  * through the RealTime architecture. ap is a list of parameters and
00361  * values used to find a specific row, e.g one parameter "name" and
00362  * one value "123" so that the SQL query becomes <code>SELECT * FROM
00363  * table WHERE name = '123';</code>.
00364  * 
00365  * \param database the database to use (ignored)
00366  * \param table      the table to use
00367  * \param ap          list of parameters and values to match
00368  * \return NULL if an error occurred, a linked list of struct ast_variable
00369  *           objects otherwise
00370  * \see add_rt_cfg_entry()
00371  */
00372 static struct ast_variable * realtime_handler(const char *database,
00373    const char *table, va_list ap);
00374 
00375 /*!
00376  * SQLite callback function for RealTime configuration.
00377  * 
00378  * This function performs the same actions as add_rt_cfg_entry() except
00379  * that the rt_multi_cfg_entry_args structure is designed to store
00380  * categories in addition of variables.
00381  * 
00382  * \param arg            a pointer to a struct rt_multi_cfg_entry_args object
00383  * \param argc          number of columns
00384  * \param argv          values in the row
00385  * \param columnNames names and types of the columns
00386  * \return 1 if an error occurred, 0 otherwise
00387  * \see rt_multi_cfg_entry_args
00388  * \see realtime_multi_handler()
00389  */
00390 static int add_rt_multi_cfg_entry(void *arg, int argc, char **argv,
00391    char **columnNames);
00392 
00393 /*!
00394  * Asterisk callback function for RealTime configuration.
00395  * 
00396  * This function performs the same actions as realtime_handler() except
00397  * that it can store variables per category, and can return several
00398  * categories.
00399  * 
00400  * \param database the database to use (ignored)
00401  * \param table      the table to use
00402  * \param ap          list of parameters and values to match
00403  * \return NULL if an error occurred, a struct ast_config object storing
00404  *           categories and variables
00405  * \see add_rt_multi_cfg_entry()
00406  */
00407 static struct ast_config * realtime_multi_handler(const char *database,
00408    const char *table,
00409    va_list ap);
00410 
00411 /*!
00412  * Asterisk callback function for RealTime configuration (variable
00413  * update).
00414  * 
00415  * Asterisk will call this function each time a variable has been modified
00416  * internally and must be updated in the backend engine. keyfield and entity
00417  * are used to find the row to update, e.g. <code>UPDATE table SET ... WHERE
00418  * keyfield = 'entity';</code>. ap is a list of parameters and values with the
00419  * same format as the other realtime functions.
00420  * 
00421  * \param database the database to use (ignored)
00422  * \param table      the table to use
00423  * \param keyfield the column of the matching cell
00424  * \param entity   the value of the matching cell
00425  * \param ap          list of parameters and new values to update in the database
00426  * \return -1 if an error occurred, the number of affected rows otherwise
00427  */
00428 static int realtime_update_handler(const char *database, const char *table,
00429    const char *keyfield, const char *entity,
00430    va_list ap);
00431 
00432 /*!
00433  * Asterisk callback function for the CLI status command.
00434  * 
00435  * \param fd    file descriptor provided by Asterisk to use with ast_cli()
00436  * \param argc number of arguments
00437  * \param argv arguments list
00438  * \return RESULT_SUCCESS
00439  */
00440 static int cli_status(int fd, int argc, char *argv[]);

00482 /*!
00483  * The structure specifying all callback functions used by Asterisk for static
00484  * and RealTime configuration.
00485  */
00486 static struct ast_config_engine sqlite_engine =
00487 {
00488    .name = RES_SQLITE_DRIVER,
00489    .load_func = config_handler,
00490    .realtime_func = realtime_handler,
00491    .realtime_multi_func = realtime_multi_handler,
00492    .update_func = realtime_update_handler
00493 };

00496  * The mutex used to prevent simultaneous access to the SQLite database.
00497  * SQLite isn't always compiled with thread safety.
00498  */
00499 AST_MUTEX_DEFINE_STATIC(mutex);

00503  * command.

00505 static struct ast_cli_entry cli_status_cmd =
00506 {

00517 /*!
00518  * SQL query format to create the CDR table if non existent.
00519  */
00520 static char *sql_create_cdr_table =
00521 "CREATE TABLE '%q' ("
00522 "  id    INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,"
00523 "  clid     VARCHAR(80) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00524 "  src      VARCHAR(80) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00525 "  dst      VARCHAR(80) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00526 "  dcontext VARCHAR(80) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00527 "  channel     VARCHAR(80) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00528 "  dstchannel  VARCHAR(80) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00529 "  lastapp     VARCHAR(80) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00530 "  lastdata VARCHAR(80) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00531 "  start    CHAR(19) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00',"
00532 "  answer      CHAR(19) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00',"
00533 "  end      CHAR(19) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0000-00-00 00:00:00',"
00534 "  duration INT(11) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',"
00535 "  billsec     INT(11) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',"
00536 "  disposition INT(11) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',"
00537 "  amaflags INT(11) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0',"
00538 "  accountcode VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00539 "  uniqueid VARCHAR(32) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',"
00540 "  userfield   VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT ''"
00541 ");";
00542 
00543 /*!
00544  * SQL query format to insert a CDR entry.
00545  */
00546 static char *sql_add_cdr_entry =
00547 "INSERT INTO '%q' ("
00548 "         clid,"
00549 "  src,"
00550 "  dst,"
00551 "  dcontext,"
00552 "  channel,"
00553 "  dstchannel,"
00554 "  lastapp,"
00555 "  lastdata,"
00556 "  start,"
00557 "  answer,"
00558 "  end,"
00559 "  duration,"
00560 "  billsec,"
00561 "  disposition,"
00562 "  amaflags,"
00563 "  accountcode,"
00564 "  uniqueid,"
00565 "  userfield"
00566 ") VALUES ("
00567 "  '%q',"
00568 "  '%q',"
00569 "  '%q',"
00570 "  '%q',"
00571 "  '%q',"
00572 "  '%q',"
00573 "  '%q',"
00574 "  '%q',"
00575 "  datetime(%d,'unixepoch'),"
00576 "  datetime(%d,'unixepoch'),"
00577 "  datetime(%d,'unixepoch'),"
00578 "  '%ld',"
00579 "  '%ld',"
00580 "  '%ld',"
00581 "  '%ld',"
00582 "  '%q',"
00583 "  '%q',"
00584 "  '%q'"
00585 ");";
00586 
00587 /*!
00588  * SQL query format to fetch the static configuration of a file.
00589  * Rows must be sorted by category.
00590  * 
00591  * @see add_cfg_entry()
00592  */
00593 static char *sql_get_config_table =
00594 "SELECT *"
00595 "  FROM '%q'"
00596 "  WHERE filename = '%q' AND commented = 0"
00597 "  ORDER BY category;";
00598 
00599 static int set_var(char **var, char *name, char *value)
00600 {
00601    if (*var)
00602       free(*var);
00603 
00604    *var = ast_strdup(value);
00605 
00606    if (!*var) {
00607       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate variable %s\n", name);
00608       return 1;
00609    }
00610 
00611    return 0;
00612 }
00613 
00614 static int check_vars(void)
00615 {
00616    if (!dbfile) {
00617       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Undefined parameter %s\n", dbfile);
00618       return 1;
00619    }
00620 
00621    use_cdr = (cdr_table != NULL);
00622 
00623    return 0;
00624 }
00625 
00626 static int load_config(void)
00627 {
00628    struct ast_config *config;
00629    struct ast_variable *var;
00630    int error;
00631 
00632    config = ast_config_load(RES_SQLITE_CONF_FILE);
00633 
00634    if (!config) {
00635       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to load " RES_SQLITE_CONF_FILE "\n");
00636       return 1;
00637    }
00638 
00639    for (var = ast_variable_browse(config, "general"); var; var = var->next) {
00640       if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "dbfile"))
00641          SET_VAR(config, dbfile, var);
00642       else if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "config_table"))
00643          SET_VAR(config, config_table, var);
00644       else if (!strcasecmp(var->name, "cdr_table"))
00645          SET_VAR(config, cdr_table, var);
00646       else
00647          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown parameter : %s\n", var->name);
00648    }
00649 
00650    ast_config_destroy(config);
00651    error = check_vars();
00652 
00653    if (error) {
00654       unload_config();
00655       return 1;
00656    }
00657 
00658    return 0;
00659 }
00660 
00661 static void unload_config(void)
00662 {
00663    free(dbfile);
00664    dbfile = NULL;
00665    free(config_table);
00666    config_table = NULL;
00667    free(cdr_table);
00668    cdr_table = NULL;
00669 }
00670 
00671 static int cdr_handler(struct ast_cdr *cdr)
00672 {
00673    char *errormsg;
00674    int error;
00675 
00676    ast_mutex_lock(&mutex);
00677 
00678    RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
00679       error = sqlite_exec_printf(db, sql_add_cdr_entry, NULL, NULL, &errormsg,
00680                 cdr_table, cdr->clid, cdr->src, cdr->dst,
00681                 cdr->dcontext, cdr->channel, cdr->dstchannel,
00682                 cdr->lastapp, cdr->lastdata, cdr->start.tv_sec,
00683                 cdr->answer.tv_sec, cdr->end.tv_sec,
00684                 cdr->duration, cdr->billsec, cdr->disposition,
00685                 cdr->amaflags, cdr->accountcode, cdr->uniqueid,
00686                 cdr->userfield);
00687    RES_SQLITE_END(error)
00688 
00689    ast_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
00690 
00691    if (error) {
00692       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", errormsg);
00693       free(errormsg);
00694       return 1;
00695    }
00696 
00697    return 0;
00698 }
00699 
00700 static int add_cfg_entry(void *arg, int argc, char **argv, char **columnNames)
00701 {
00702    struct cfg_entry_args *args;
00703    struct ast_variable *var;
00704 
00705    if (argc != RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_COLUMNS) {
00706       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Corrupt table\n");
00707       return 1;
00708    }
00709 
00710    args = arg;
00711 
00712    if (!args->cat_name || strcmp(args->cat_name, argv[RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_CATEGORY])) {
00713       args->cat = ast_category_new(argv[RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_CATEGORY]);
00714 
00715       if (!args->cat) {
00716          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate category\n");
00717          return 1;
00718       }
00719 
00720       free(args->cat_name);
00721       args->cat_name = ast_strdup(argv[RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_CATEGORY]);
00722 
00723       if (!args->cat_name) {
00724          ast_category_destroy(args->cat);
00725          return 1;
00726       }
00727 
00728       ast_category_append(args->cfg, args->cat);
00729    }
00730 
00731    var = ast_variable_new(argv[RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_VAR_NAME],
00732        argv[RES_SQLITE_CONFIG_VAR_VAL]);
00733 
00734    if (!var) {
00735       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate variable");
00736       return 1;
00737    }
00738 
00739    ast_variable_append(args->cat, var);
00740    
00741    return 0;
00742 }
00743 
00744 static struct ast_config *config_handler(const char *database, 
00745    const char *table, const char *file, struct ast_config *cfg, int withcomments)
00746 {
00747    struct cfg_entry_args args;
00748    char *errormsg;
00749    int error;
00750 
00751    if (!config_table) {
00752       if (!table) {
00753          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Table name unspecified\n");
00754          return NULL;
00755       }
00756    } else
00757       table = config_table;
00758 
00759    args.cfg = cfg;
00760    args.cat = NULL;
00761    args.cat_name = NULL;
00762 
00763    ast_mutex_lock(&mutex);
00764 
00765    RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
00766       error = sqlite_exec_printf(db, sql_get_config_table, add_cfg_entry,
00767                &args, &errormsg, table, file);
00768    RES_SQLITE_END(error)
00769 
00770    ast_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
00771 
00772    free(args.cat_name);
00773 
00774    if (error) {
00775       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", errormsg);
00776       free(errormsg);
00777       return NULL;
00778    }
00779 
00780    return cfg;
00781 }
00782 
00783 static size_t get_params(va_list ap, const char ***params_ptr, const char ***vals_ptr)
00784 {
00785    const char **tmp, *param, *val, **params, **vals;
00786    size_t params_count;
00787 
00788    params = NULL;
00789    vals = NULL;
00790    params_count = 0;
00791 
00792    while ((param = va_arg(ap, const char *)) && (val = va_arg(ap, const char *))) {
00793       if (!(tmp = ast_realloc(params, (params_count + 1) * sizeof(char *)))) {
00794          free(params);
00795          free(vals);
00796          return 0;
00797       }
00798       params = tmp;
00799 
00800       if (!(tmp = ast_realloc(vals, (params_count + 1) * sizeof(char *)))) {
00801          free(params);
00802          free(vals);
00803          return 0;
00804       }
00805       vals = tmp;
00806 
00807       params[params_count] = param;
00808       vals[params_count] = val;
00809       params_count++;
00810    }
00811 
00812    if (params_count)
00813       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "1 parameter and 1 value at least required\n");
00814    else {
00815       *params_ptr = params;
00816       *vals_ptr = vals;
00817    }
00818 
00819    return params_count;
00820 }
00821 
00822 static int add_rt_cfg_entry(void *arg, int argc, char **argv, char **columnNames)
00823 {
00824    struct rt_cfg_entry_args *args;
00825    struct ast_variable *var;
00826    int i;
00827 
00828    args = arg;
00829 
00830    for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
00831       if (!argv[i])
00832          continue;
00833 
00834       if (!(var = ast_variable_new(columnNames[i], argv[i])))
00835          return 1;
00836 
00837       if (!args->var)
00838          args->var = var;
00839 
00840       if (!args->last)
00841          args->last = var;
00842       else {
00843          args->last->next = var;
00844          args->last = var;
00845       }
00846    }
00847 
00848    return 0;
00849 }
00850 
00851 static struct ast_variable *
00852 realtime_handler(const char *database, const char *table, va_list ap)
00853 {
00854    char *query, *errormsg, *op, *tmp_str;
00855    struct rt_cfg_entry_args args;
00856    const char **params, **vals;
00857    size_t params_count;
00858    int error;
00859 
00860    if (!table) {
00861       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Table name unspecified\n");
00862       return NULL;
00863    }
00864 
00865    params_count = get_params(ap, &params, &vals);
00866 
00867    if (params_count == 0)
00868       return NULL;
00869 
00870    op = (strchr(params[0], ' ') == NULL) ? " =" : "";
00871 
00872 /* \cond DOXYGEN_CAN_PARSE_THIS */
00873 #undef QUERY
00874 #define QUERY "SELECT * FROM '%q' WHERE commented = 0 AND %q%s '%q'"
00875 /* \endcond */
00876 
00877    query = sqlite_mprintf(QUERY, table, params[0], op, vals[0]);
00878 
00879    if (!query) {
00880       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate SQL query\n");
00881       free(params);
00882       free(vals);
00883       return NULL;
00884    }
00885 
00886    if (params_count > 1) {
00887       size_t i;
00888 
00889       for (i = 1; i < params_count; i++) {
00890          op = (strchr(params[i], ' ') == NULL) ? " =" : "";
00891          tmp_str = sqlite_mprintf("%s AND %q%s '%q'", query, params[i], op,
00892                                               vals[i]);
00893          sqlite_freemem(query);
00894 
00895          if (!tmp_str) {
00896             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to reallocate SQL query\n");
00897             free(params);
00898             free(vals);
00899             return NULL;
00900          }
00901 
00902          query = tmp_str;
00903       }
00904    }
00905 
00906    free(params);
00907    free(vals);
00908 
00909    tmp_str = sqlite_mprintf("%s LIMIT 1;", query);
00910    sqlite_freemem(query);
00911 
00912    if (!tmp_str) {
00913       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to reallocate SQL query\n");
00914       return NULL;
00915    }
00916 
00917    query = tmp_str;
00918    ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "SQL query: %s\n", query);
00919    args.var = NULL;
00920    args.last = NULL;
00921 
00922    ast_mutex_lock(&mutex);
00923 
00924    RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
00925       error = sqlite_exec(db, query, add_rt_cfg_entry, &args, &errormsg);
00926    RES_SQLITE_END(error)
00927 
00928    ast_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
00929 
00930    sqlite_freemem(query);
00931 
00932    if (error) {
00933       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s\n", errormsg);
00934       free(errormsg);
00935       ast_variables_destroy(args.var);
00936       return NULL;
00937    }
00938 
00939    return args.var;
00940 }
00941 
00942 static int add_rt_multi_cfg_entry(void *arg, int argc, char **argv, char **columnNames)
00943 {
00944    struct rt_multi_cfg_entry_args *args;
00945    struct ast_category *cat;
00946    struct ast_variable *var;
00947    char *cat_name;
00948    size_t i;
00949 
00950    args = (struct rt_multi_cfg_entry_args *)arg;
00951    cat_name = NULL;
00952 
00953    /*
00954     * cat_name should always be set here, since initfield is forged from
00955     * params[0] in realtime_multi_handler(), which is a search parameter
00956     * of the SQL query.
00957     */
00958    for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
00959       if (!strcmp(args->initfield, columnNames[i]))
00960          cat_name = argv[i];
00961    }
00962 
00963    if (!cat_name) {
00964       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Bogus SQL results, cat_name is NULL !\n");
00965       return 1;
00966    }
00967 
00968    if (!(cat = ast_category_new(cat_name))) {
00969       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate category\n");
00970       return 1;
00971    }
00972 
00973    ast_category_append(args->cfg, cat);
00974 
00975    for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
00976       if (!argv[i] || !strcmp(args->initfield, columnNames[i]))
00977          continue;
00978 
00979       if (!(var = ast_variable_new(columnNames[i], argv[i]))) {
00980          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate variable\n");
00981          return 1;
00982       }
00983 
00984       ast_variable_append(cat, var);
00985    }
00986 
00987    return 0;
00988 }
00989 
00990 static struct ast_config *realtime_multi_handler(const char *database, 
00991    const char *table, va_list ap)
00992 {
00993    char *query, *errormsg, *op, *tmp_str, *initfield;
00994    struct rt_multi_cfg_entry_args args;
00995    const char **params, **vals;
00996    struct ast_config *cfg;
00997    size_t params_count;
00998    int error;
00999 
01000    if (!table) {
01001       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Table name unspecified\n");
01002       return NULL;
01003    }
01004 
01005    if (!(cfg = ast_config_new())) {
01006       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate configuration structure\n");
01007       return NULL;
01008    }
01009 
01010    if (!(params_count = get_params(ap, &params, &vals))) {
01011       ast_config_destroy(cfg);
01012       return NULL;
01013    }
01014 
01015    if (!(initfield = ast_strdup(params[0]))) {
01016       ast_config_destroy(cfg);
01017       free(params);
01018       free(vals);
01019       return NULL;
01020    }
01021 
01022    tmp_str = strchr(initfield, ' ');
01023 
01024    if (tmp_str)
01025       *tmp_str = '\0';
01026 
01027    op = (!strchr(params[0], ' ')) ? " =" : "";
01028 
01029    /*
01030     * Asterisk sends us an already escaped string when searching for
01031     * "exten LIKE" (uh!). Handle it separately.
01032     */
01033    tmp_str = (!strcmp(vals[0], "\\_%")) ? "_%" : (char *)vals[0];
01034 
01035 /* \cond DOXYGEN_CAN_PARSE_THIS */
01036 #undef QUERY
01037 #define QUERY "SELECT * FROM '%q' WHERE commented = 0 AND %q%s '%q'"
01038 /* \endcond */
01039 
01040    if (!(query = sqlite_mprintf(QUERY, table, params[0], op, tmp_str))) {
01041       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate SQL query\n");
01042       ast_config_destroy(cfg);
01043       free(params);
01044       free(vals);
01045       free(initfield);
01046       return NULL;
01047    }
01048 
01049    if (params_count > 1) {
01050       size_t i;
01051 
01052       for (i = 1; i < params_count; i++) {
01053          op = (!strchr(params[i], ' ')) ? " =" : "";
01054          tmp_str = sqlite_mprintf("%s AND %q%s '%q'", query, params[i], op,
01055                                               vals[i]);
01056          sqlite_freemem(query);
01057 
01058          if (!tmp_str) {
01059             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to reallocate SQL query\n");
01060             ast_config_destroy(cfg);
01061             free(params);
01062             free(vals);
01063             free(initfield);
01064             return NULL;
01065          }
01066 
01067          query = tmp_str;
01068       }
01069    }
01070 
01071    free(params);
01072    free(vals);
01073 
01074    if (!(tmp_str = sqlite_mprintf("%s ORDER BY %q;", query, initfield))) {
01075       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to reallocate SQL query\n");
01076       ast_config_destroy(cfg);
01077       free(initfield);
01078       return NULL;
01079    }
01080 
01081    sqlite_freemem(query);
01082    query = tmp_str;
01083    ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "SQL query: %s\n", query);
01084    args.cfg = cfg;
01085    args.initfield = initfield;
01086 
01087    ast_mutex_lock(&mutex);
01088 
01089    RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
01090       error = sqlite_exec(db, query, add_rt_multi_cfg_entry, &args, &errormsg);
01091    RES_SQLITE_END(error)
01092 
01093    ast_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
01094 
01095    sqlite_freemem(query);
01096    free(initfield);
01097 
01098    if (error) {
01099       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s\n", errormsg);
01100       free(errormsg);
01101       ast_config_destroy(cfg);
01102       return NULL;
01103    }
01104 
01105    return cfg;
01106 }
01107 
01108 static int realtime_update_handler(const char *database, const char *table,
01109    const char *keyfield, const char *entity,
01110    va_list ap)
01111 {
01112    char *query, *errormsg, *tmp_str;
01113    const char **params, **vals;
01114    size_t params_count;
01115    int error, rows_num;
01116 
01117    if (!table) {
01118       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Table name unspecified\n");
01119       return -1;
01120    }
01121 
01122    if (!(params_count = get_params(ap, &params, &vals)))
01123       return -1;
01124 
01125 /* \cond DOXYGEN_CAN_PARSE_THIS */
01126 #undef QUERY
01127 #define QUERY "UPDATE '%q' SET %q = '%q'"
01128 /* \endcond */
01129 
01130    if (!(query = sqlite_mprintf(QUERY, table, params[0], vals[0]))) {
01131       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate SQL query\n");
01132       free(params);
01133       free(vals);
01134       return -1;
01135    }
01136 
01137    if (params_count > 1) {
01138       size_t i;
01139 
01140       for (i = 1; i < params_count; i++) {
01141          tmp_str = sqlite_mprintf("%s, %q = '%q'", query, params[i],
01142                                               vals[i]);
01143          sqlite_freemem(query);
01144 
01145          if (!tmp_str) {
01146             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to reallocate SQL query\n");
01147             free(params);
01148             free(vals);
01149             return -1;
01150          }
01151 
01152          query = tmp_str;
01153       }
01154    }
01155 
01156    free(params);
01157    free(vals);
01158 
01159    if (!(tmp_str = sqlite_mprintf("%s WHERE %q = '%q';", query, keyfield, entity))) {
01160       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to reallocate SQL query\n");
01161       return -1;
01162    }
01163 
01164    sqlite_freemem(query);
01165    query = tmp_str;
01166    ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "SQL query: %s\n", query);
01167 
01168    ast_mutex_lock(&mutex);
01169 
01170    RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
01171       error = sqlite_exec(db, query, NULL, NULL, &errormsg);
01172    RES_SQLITE_END(error)
01173 
01174    if (!error)
01175       rows_num = sqlite_changes(db);
01176    else
01177       rows_num = -1;
01178 
01179    ast_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
01180 
01181    sqlite_freemem(query);
01182 
01183    if (error) {
01184       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s\n", errormsg);
01185       free(errormsg);
01186    }
01187 
01188    return rows_num;
01189 }
01190 
01191 static int cli_status(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
01192 {
01193    ast_cli(fd, "SQLite database path: %s\n", dbfile);
01194    ast_cli(fd, "config_table: ");
01195 
01196    if (!config_table)
01197       ast_cli(fd, "unspecified, must be present in extconfig.conf\n");
01198    else
01199       ast_cli(fd, "%s\n", config_table);
01200 
01201    ast_cli(fd, "cdr_table: ");
01202 
01203    if (!cdr_table)
01204       ast_cli(fd, "unspecified, CDR support disabled\n");
01205    else
01206       ast_cli(fd, "%s\n", cdr_table);
01207 
01208    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
01209 }
01210 
01211 static int unload_module(void)
01212 {
01213    if (cli_status_registered)
01214       ast_cli_unregister(&cli_status_cmd);
01215 
01216    if (cdr_registered)
01217       ast_cdr_unregister(RES_SQLITE_NAME);
01218 
01219    ast_config_engine_deregister(&sqlite_engine);
01220 
01221    if (db)
01222       sqlite_close(db);
01223 
01224    unload_config();
01225 
01226    return 0;
01227 }
01228 
01229 static int load_module(void)
01230 {
01231    char *errormsg;
01232    int error;
01233 
01234    db = NULL;
01235    cdr_registered = 0;
01236    cli_status_registered = 0;
01237    dbfile = NULL;
01238    config_table = NULL;
01239    cdr_table = NULL;
01240    vm_count = 0;
01241    error = load_config();
01242 
01243    if (error)
01244       return AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE;
01245 
01246    if (!(db = sqlite_open(dbfile, 0660, &errormsg))) {
01247       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", errormsg);
01248       free(errormsg);
01249       unload_module();
01250       return 1;
01251    }
01252 
01253    ast_config_engine_register(&sqlite_engine);
01254 
01255    if (use_cdr) {
01256       RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
01257          error = sqlite_exec_printf(db, "SELECT COUNT(id) FROM %Q;", NULL, NULL,
01258                                                  &errormsg, cdr_table);
01259       RES_SQLITE_END(error)
01260 
01261       if (error) {
01262          /*
01263           * Unexpected error.
01264           */
01265          if (error != SQLITE_ERROR) {
01266             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", errormsg);
01267             free(errormsg);
01268             unload_module();
01269             return 1;
01270          }
01271 
01272          RES_SQLITE_BEGIN
01273             error = sqlite_exec_printf(db, sql_create_cdr_table, NULL, NULL,
01274                         &errormsg, cdr_table);
01275          RES_SQLITE_END(error)
01276 
01277          if (error) {
01278             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "%s\n", errormsg);
01279             free(errormsg);
01280             unload_module();
01281             return 1;
01282          }
01283       }
01284 
01285       error = ast_cdr_register(RES_SQLITE_NAME, RES_SQLITE_DESCRIPTION,
01286                                            cdr_handler);
01287 
01288       if (error) {
01289          unload_module();
01290          return 1;
01291       }
01292 
01293       cdr_registered = 1;
01294    }
01295 
01296    error = ast_cli_register(&cli_status_cmd);
01297 
01298    if (error) {
01299       unload_module();
01300       return 1;
01301    }
01302 
01303    cli_status_registered = 1;
01304 
01305    return 0;
01306 }
01307 
01308 AST_MODULE_INFO(ASTERISK_GPL_KEY, AST_MODFLAG_GLOBAL_SYMBOLS, "SQLite Configuration",
01309       .load = load_module,
01310       .unload = unload_module,
01311 );
